title: ‘Unruly’ passengers delay Metro-North trains
maintext:
“Unruly’ passengers and a suspicious package caused some delays of Metro-North trains on Monday morning.
Metro-North first sent out an advisory around 9 a.m. saying “service between Stamford and Bridgeport is currently experiencing eastbound delays up to 10 minutes due to police activity in South Norwalk.”
Nancy Gamerman, Metro-North spokesperson said “the MTAPD was called for police assistance on account of two unruly customers as well as an unattended bag in the car. The customers were removed from the train, and the bag was cleared by the MTAPD. The train was delayed for about 18 minutes as a result of the incident.”
Delays continued to mid-morning because of the earlier incident.
